meanings.definition: To swallow hastily or in large amounts.
meanings.sent1: She was gulping down her water after a long run.
meanings.sent2: The hungry dog was gulping down its food.
meanings.sent3: The baby was gulping down milk so fast, it seemed like a race.
meanings.sent4: The river was gulping down the heavy rain, swelling its banks.
meanings.sent5: He was gulping down his fear before the big speech.

meanings.definition: The act of swallowing hastily or in large amounts.
meanings.sent1: His loud gulping could be heard across the room.
meanings.sent2: The doctor advised against fast gulping of food to prevent indigestion.
meanings.sent3: The gulping of the water fountain made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The gulping of resources by the project left little for other departments.
meanings.sent5: The gulping of air after the sprint left him breathless.
